c74object.name: mvc.message.remote
c74object.digest: Monitor and remote control values from an mvc.message.
c74object.description:
mvc.message.remote allows to bind to an mvc.message for remote control or monitoring. The mvc.message it refers to can be set dynamically and multiple addresses can be provided through brace expansion notation.
mvc.message.remote helps implementing the view and controller part in the MVC model used in the MVC package.

outlet.digest: Monitored mvc.message address with index in the mvc.message.remote namespace (see below)

objarg.name: message-address
objarg.description:
If a single argument is provided, the address of the monitored mvc.message should be expressed with slash-separated symbols (Ã la OSC). The last item in this OSC string will be considered as the name of the mvc.message and everything that is before the last slash will be considered as the path of the address.
If no slash is present in the address, the symbol will be simply be considered as a mvc.message name and will wait for a path to this name to initialize.

objarg.name: message-address
objarg.description: If two arguments are provided, the first argument will be considered as the path of the address and the second argument as the name of the mvc.message. The resulting address will be the concatenation of the path and the name.

method.name: anything
method.digest: Feed values to mvc.message.remote (on the left inlet).
method.description: The values fed to the left inlet will be sent to all addresses covered by the mvc.message.remote namespace, given an matching mvc.message address exists.

method.name: setvalue
method.digest: Set the value of a specific address in the mvc.message.remote namespace (on the left inlet).
method.description:
setvalue is a possible method on the left inlet.
The values will be sent to the addresses of the mvc.message.remote at the specified index (following the setvalue method in MC components).

method.name: name
method.digest: Set the target mvc.message name (on the right inlet).
method.description:
name is a possible method on the right inlet.
A full mvc.message address is made up by concatenating a path and a name. Multiple mvc.message addresses can be set with the brace expansion notation.

method.name: path
method.digest: Set the path of the target mvc.message (on the right inlet).
method.description:
path is a possible method on the right inlet.
A full mvc.message address is made up by concatenating a path and a name. Multiple mvc.message addresses can be set with the brace expansion notation.

method.name: address
method.digest: Sets the value of a specific address in the mvc.message.remote namespace (on the right inlet).
method.description:
address is a possible method on the right inlet.
The address of a specific mvc.message can be given as an OSC formatted symbol. A full mvc.message address is considered to be the concatenation of a path and a name.
When setting a full address, the mvc.message.remote will parse it and implicitely set the name as the last part of the address and the path as everything that comes before this last part.
Multiple mvc.message addresses can be set with the brace expansion notation.
